intro: Lysimachia ramosa var. zeylanica, commonly known as Zeylanic willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The plant features wiry stems that are often branched and covered with small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its ability to thrive in wet conditions.
